definition: coupons for food or grain used in a PRC economic program c. 1955-1993
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: My mother's food coupons will go to the British Museum as I have promised.
sentences.chinese: 我已經答應把母親留給我的糧票捐贈給大英博物館。

sentences.english: Borrow money from China, and give out those food stamps Obama.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬從中國借錢，給美國人發糧票。

sentences.english: I am one of the guys who pays tax to support your monthly food stamp.
sentences.chinese: 我就是那個每個月付錢給你買糧票的那個人。

sentences.english: It was a place where mothers waited for hours with their ration tickets in hand to buy their monthly allotment of milk powder or rice.
sentences.chinese: 母親們手執糧票等待數小時買每月分配的奶粉或大米。

sentences.english: I arrived in Shanghai back in the days of Liang Piao and FEC.
sentences.chinese: 我到上海的時候，還是有糧票和外匯券的時代。

sentences.english: I arrived in Shanghai back in the days of Liang Piao ( Ration tickets) and FEC ( Foreign Exchange Currency).
sentences.chinese: 我到上海的時候，還是有糧票和外匯券的時代。

definition: consecutive serial numbers/chain (of supermarkets, hotels etc)/hyphen
lit. to play the yu 竽 mouth organ to make up numbers (idiom); fig. to make up the numbers with inferior products/to masquerade as having an ability/token member of a group
a device used to check money and detect counterfeit bills
